abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Hubei Urban
            Environment Project for China was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was likely, and the Bank and borrower performance
            were both satisfactory. Lessons learned from the project:
            When new project agencies and implementing units are being
            established in conjunction with a project, and related
            institutional and financial sector reforms are to be
            advanced, this project demonstrated the importance of
            setting the corresponding reform targets. While the
            monitoring indicators provided in the SAR, and subsequently
            enhanced in conjunction with the additional works, were
            overall comprehensive in the Chinese context. Project
            agencies and implementing units should in future similar
            projects include to the extent possible. Civil works
            contracts in infrastructure projects in China do not attract
            any interest internationally. As realistic processing times
            as possible for GOC and Bank contract reviews should be
            included in implementation schedules to avoid the appearance
            of implementation delays.
